summary_reasoning: The report fails on all five pillars of assumption quality. Explicitness: Key assumptions are buried in an appendix table with no connection to forecasts. Justification: Critical parameters like 20% operating margin and 10% WACC are completely unjustified—described as 'assumed expansion' and 'standard tech discount' without any evidence. Specificity: The revenue CAGR claim of 30% contradicts the report's own growth data (29-36% range doesn't support a point estimate). Consistency: Multiple contradictions exist, including claiming insufficient data throughout while simultaneously providing specific forecasts. Sensitivity: Zero quantified scenarios or stress-testing despite material uncertainty. The assumptions appear disconnected from any actual financial model, making outputs feel entirely black-box.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Revenue CAGR 30.0% Based on recent growth
implies a fair value multiple of 10x sales

contradictions.description: Claims insufficient data throughout report while providing specific forecasts and assumptions
locations: Financials Snapshot shows all metrics as 'insufficient'

contradictions.description: Revenue CAGR of 30% doesn't align with stated growth range of 29-36%
locations: Text shows growth rates from 29% to 36%
